SENT.plain: Little objective documentation is available regarding the efficacy of therapies for oropharyngeal dysphagia
Information specifying efficacy of treatment for chronic dysphagic conditions is almost nonexistent
This report describes a direct therapy program for chronic neurogenic dysphagia resulting from brainstem stroke, and provides information on immediate and long-term clinical outcome
Changes in swallowing physiology reflect goals of therapy
Long-term follow-up shows that functional benefits are long lasting without related health complications
